page.title: 08Rebuilding Ellary Bridge
page.content: About half a mile down the Ellary road is a beautiful old stone bridge. But it is too narrow, and the angle is wrong for lorries bringing in hay, fertilizer etc. and the cattle floats going out with animals at sale times. It was decided to build a replacement bridge beside the old one. The work, which involved some blasting, started in May 1984 and took 6 months. The new bridge is made of steel girders and reinforced concrete, and has new approaches from the single_track road on either side. All through the rebuilding the old stone bridge remained open and it has now been restored and repointed. It is from these 2 bridges that Achahoish Graveyard can be reached (see page 3 of the printed text).
